body_html:
You might be able to trace the HLO graph dumping from the handling of the TF_XLA_FLAGS environment variable and the xla_dump_* command-line flags.

As XLA is in early stages, documentation (and indeed the implementation) of these details is not something that is finalized and thus easily accessible yet.

Does that help?

(CC @tatatodd @eliben in case they have something to add)
body_text:
You might be able to trace the HLO graph dumping from the handling of the TF_XLA_FLAGS environment variable and the xla_dump_* command-line flags.
As XLA is in early stages, documentation (and indeed the implementation) of these details is not something that is finalized and thus easily accessible yet.
Does that help?
(CC @tatatodd @eliben in case they have something to add)
body:
You might be able to trace the HLO graph dumping from the handling of the [`TF_XLA_FLAGS`](https://github.com/tensorflow/tensorflow/blob/f94e20f2c704f037a113d350fd7c431e3fd75df8/tensorflow/compiler/xla/legacy_flags/parse_flags_from_env.h#L20) environment variable and the [`xla_dump_*`](https://github.com/tensorflow/tensorflow/blob/master/tensorflow/compiler/xla/legacy_flags/service_flags.cc#L75) command-line flags.

As XLA is in early stages, documentation (and indeed the implementation) of these details is not something that is finalized and thus easily accessible yet. 

Does that help?

(CC @tatatodd @eliben in case they have something to add)
